properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 4:53AM PST until January 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW TODAY...

.A potent winter storm will move into the Inland Northwest
Friday. Light snow will begin in the morning hours on Friday with
snow intensity increasing Friday afternoon and night.  Snow
showers will linger through Saturday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6
inches north of Ritzville and east of Coulee City, including
the Highway 2 corridor. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph.

* WHERE...Wilbur, Creston, Harrington and Sprague.

* WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility along Highway 2. The hazardous
conditions could impact the Friday morning commute and will
impact the Friday evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas in and around Coulee City and
Ritzville will also experience accumulating snow with 1 to 3
inches likely.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING
